turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Palaeonemertea.
turn.1: What is known about the palaeonemertea?
turn.2: Palaeonemertea  Palaeonemertea is an order of primitive nemertean worm.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: It may be para- or polyphyletic, consisting of three to five clades and totalling about 100 species.
turn.6: These worms have several apparently simple features and, as their name suggests, they are often considered to be the most primitive nemerteans.
turn.7: Any other interesting information you can share?
turn.8: The primary body-wall musculature consists of an outer circular layer overlying a longitudinal layer.
turn.9: Do they have any other names?
turn.10: The group includes genera such as "Cephalothrix" in which the nerve cords are inside the body-wall longitudinal muscle, and "Tubulanus", in which the nerve cords are between the outer circular muscle and the epidermis.
turn.11: What are some of the species?
turn.12: Tubulanids are commonly encountered in rocky areas of intertidal zones in the northern hemisphere.
